reviews.sentence: Hidden costs rude staff not a place to stay. Hidden charges there was a 50 per day charge for incidentals. do not move anything in the refrige or on the snack bar it is charged. If it was an accident make sure you tell the desk or you will be charged. It will take 2 3 days to see this amount refunded to my credit card. The 25 per day hotel fee includes a shuttle but it only goes to the Outlet Mall. I requested my money back since the shuttle did not take me where I requested or the airport the Manager. stated that the shuttle service is stated on the hotel website it is not stated on Expedia Website. The staff was very rude. I wanted to see the pools but I was not in a swim suit. I was not allowed to the see the pools. The slot machine were very tight and I won more at other hotels. I will not stay at this hotel again or recommend it to anyone. Nothing Great German Restaurant. State all the hidden fees on the website for booking.
Great hotel but Cleanliness beds parking wifi staff facility. MLocation limited shuttle pools.

Wish i stayed on strip. First there was construction being done in lobby. Second the casino is limited to one roulette table and for entire stay we were there 5 days. one Texas Holdem poker table. The pools were not available to hotel guests on 3 of our days there and hot tubs are located in area were during weekends you either pay for pool parties or you ca nt use them. Add the fact that due to a corporate event the pool and hotubs were not open for another day and you realize your not able to use the basic things you expect at a normal hotel much less a Resort. Now lets continue to location. your off the strip so expect cab rides of avg 15 each way 4 or 6 times a day and that shuttle service to the strip that is mentioned at check in every 15 minutes. after wating for it two days in the 100 degree heat and deciding to grab a cab we finally see one of the shuttles and upon speaking to driver are informed oh no sir it is once an hour. so on third day we try to grab the shuttle at 8 pm to eat dinner on the strip. sorry shuttle stops running at 7 pm.
Nice hotel but far from the strip. The shuttle runs only every hour until 5 pm. No so convenient.

NOT WHAT I EXPECTED COULD DO MUCH BETTER. Great size in property Bad notes. the walk with our luggage from the registration counter was too long till paradise tower the entire hotel is carpeted so it was even more difficult to drag our bags. they could arrange for another counter for registration check out next to the paradise tower. To get to the free shuttle service it is far from our tower in short inside movement is tiring In fact to even to get to Uber we need to go all the way to the main entrance from our tower. the hotel does not provide any free coupons for facilities like other hotels provide. The room we stayed in had a bad smell coming from the drainage every time we took a shower the same has been informed to the hotel stafthe hotel is not on the strip so get set to walk for about 15 mins to get to the strip or you can Uber it which would cost you around 5 6House keeping the slowest we have ever seen. when we entered our room there were no in room slippers bathrobe vanity box etc. we called the house keeping to provide us we waited for 45 mins and no one turned up. we left for sight seeing and when we returned all the goods had arrived. Internet connection in the room is very unstable. it connects and disconnects very frequently. Good notes. the staff upgraded us from Casino tower to Paradise tower Plenty of options when it comes to dinning with in the hotelshutle services to 2 points makes it easy to plan your sight seeing. Fantastic room rates. size of the room is big. advise guest to take the Deuce bus 3 day pass to commute all around the strip and head to down town Fremont strip. its affordable than uber. DUE TO BAD WEATHER THE POOLS WERE CLOSED FOR DAY SECOND DAY WE COULD STILL SEE MUD ON THE POOL FLOORS.

Nice stay but medium location can be improved. Nice and big pool facilities can accommodate relaxed stay as well as partying can find seabeds with shadow big pool party held every Sunday and good music. Clean modern room with nice decoration much better than other hotels we stayed at. Fitness studio included in the price. Wifi just decent as in most hotels definitely not doing youtube. Appealing for young travellers as well as families. Close to the airport and close to amenities. Bad location 25 minute walk from Strip. Could be easily tackled if there was a 24hour free shuttle to and from the Strip centre Belagio fountains or similar every half an hour or so. Unfortunately there is only an hourly shuttle stopping at 5 pm taking you to the Fashion Show mall which is further north on the Strip maybe intentionally. Were given inconvenient room with zero view and far from elevators maybe need to tip for a better room. Hotel is not massive but still has many options. Uncomfortable bed.

Las Vegas stay at Hard Rock Hotel. Luckys was really good the steak bar expensivewas not aware that the location was quite so far from the strip. The Courtesy bus was good but could have been a little more frequent and although the traffic is heavier at night due to the local surroundings it did not feel good to be walking back late at night the bus would have been a help.

Great Hotel. Stayed there for 3 nights in January with my mom and cousin. Full of famous artists instruments and clothes as you could expect from a Hard Rock facility. So for those who likes music can be interesting. Also the hotel is not located in the Strip it is around a 10 15 minutes walk. The rooms are nice so be careful to do not touch anything on the candy bar or the fridge even if you just move any item you will be charged. watch out for kids.

Not the usual Vegas vibe hotel. My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights recently for my 30th birthday. We booked a room in the HRH Tower which are slightly more upscale rooms and we were definitely glad we did. The room was very spacious with a nice lounge area with a corner sofa and separate bedroom area separated by a tv wall. The noise proofing was very good we did n’t hear a thing during our stay which was impressive given the amount of things going on in the hotel. The bathroom was huge with a nice marble his and hers sink a ‘ tea for two ’ bath and a separate shower. There are a few restaurant options within the hotel but not as many as some of the bigger resorts so something to keep in mind. One thing that really annoyed me was the Dunkin Donuts in the hotel it was more than double the normal price. Save yourself the cash and walk across the road to the Dunkin Donuts there. The hotel run a free shuttle bus on the hour between 10AM5PM which drops off and picks up at the Fashion Show Mall. This is definitely necessary as it is too far to walk to the main strip. Overall the hotel was very clean and all the staff we encountered in the hotel and casino were all very pleasant. However this definitely has a smaller and quieter vibe than many of the hotels on the strip but given its location off the strip this is n’t really surprising. I think it really depends what you want from your time in Vegas and for us we would have prepared to have been closer to the main action rather than having to get a bus or uber everytime we wanted to go to another resort. However I do n’t think you ’l be disappointed if you stay here especially in the HRH Tower as it is a very cool hotel.

Poor shuttle service. Great room great place. Service for free shuttle not good. Waited for free shuttle that runs every hour when it showed up we were polite and allowed other to load before us and when it came time for our party of four to board there was not enough room shuttle driver said if we had a bigger party he could return and take us but since there were only four of us we would have to walk or Uber. The walk is only a few blocks but that is not good service in my opinion. If you offer the service as a benefit of the hotel honor the service or state first come first serve at least then people know not to be polite and force there way on the shuttle or count the people waiting and know to start your walk.
Great place for concerts pool events and good location.

Wonderful hotel great staff great pool. Marvellous view from the room comfy beds good location free parking good WiFi connection Staff at the reception was very helpful and friendly. Also the staff in the restaurants. Amazing pool but unable to get sunbeds next to the pool because all seats were reserved but no one on them.

Family trip. A great hotel for a big family group. Staff very friendly and helpful. Bars within casino not too expensive which was great at the end of a busy day sightseeing. Plenty of choice for mealsNevada pool for guests only really nice good drinks with towes available Car park easy to findThe complementary bus is great but unfortunately finishes early eveningThe only negative is that it is nearly a mile to the strip.

nice hotel its located 6 10 mins near main street of vegas but the hotel offer a free bus until 5 pm to take u to the main street. very friendly staff and offers of hotels. we did nt like that we are using only One part of the swimming pool to use the other part u needed to pay forthe parties so the swimming pool was small.

Nice hotel in the good location. Room was spacious clean with comfortable beds. Staff was kind and helpful. I also like the design of the hotel with all the bands ’ attributes on every corner. Lack of amenities. We had 3body lotions and no shampoo or shower gel in our bathroom. Pools were closed for some private event so we could not use it.
It was a great time. I was not burdened by the local traffic and was able to get to all of locations I was looking forward to attending. thank you.
I went to the Hard Rock Hotel Casino for the 5th Anniversary of Mondays Dark. It was a great location for a fun charity event.

Hard Rock Hotel and Casino delivered great value at a premium location. Rooms were really big beds super comfy. Loved the hotel easy access to the Strip. Nice on site dining options. Casino is not too huge so it is easy to get around. Only downside the tub shower is a really high step up if you have someone with mobility issues be sure to ask for an ADA room. Other thing to note now that marijuana is legal in Nevada for recreational use it is everywhere. Stay away from the big casino hotels if you have small kids and do not want to expose them to pot because you can get a contact high in the evenings when the casino is packed.

People smoking at the pool next to my child. it ’s. allowed Everywhere. Very dark rooms with barely any lights I could not see anything in my luggage. No ice buckets in the room. No room in the fridge to put A bottle of water. To go to the pool it ’s a 10 minute walk from my room and of course you have to go through the stinky casino. I would n’t stay there again. The shuttle that takes you to the main strip was a nice touch.
Wonderful. Clean and good location. Light that did not work short on soap missing tv remote all items taken care of quickly when notified but should have been caught at cleaning stage.
